casebody.data:
James GOODSON, Employee-Plaintiff and
N.C. Department of Insurance, ex rel. James Long, Commissioner, Intervenor
v.
P.H. GLATFELTER CO., Employer-Defendant.
Langdon M. Cooper, Trustee in Bankruptcy for RFS Ecusta, Inc., Defendant and
North Carolina Self-Insurance Guaranty Association, Defendant. No. 464P05. Supreme Court of North Carolina. November 3, 2005. Robert C. Paschal, John N. Fountain, Michael W. Ballance, Raleigh, for P.H. Glatfelter Co. Neill S. Fuleihan, Timothy L. Finger, for James Goodson. Langdon M. Cooper, Jesse V. Bone, Jr., Jason R. Shoemaker, Gastonia, for Langdon M. Cooper Trustee. Clementine Peterson, for N.C. Dept. of Insurance. Catherine Stuart, Charles C. Kyles, Raleigh, for N.C. Self-Ins. Guaranty.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Defendant (P.H. Glatfelter Co.) on the 23rd day of August 2005 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 3rd day of November 2005."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 23rd day of August 2005 by Defendant (P.H. Glatfelter Co.) in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 3rd day of November 2005."
